  21++C96F              ;ClipXX15XX12Line:
  22++C96F ED 4B 89 C0  ClipLine:               ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)          ; bc - XX15(2,3)
  23++C973 DD 2A 8D C0                          ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)          ; ix - XX12(0,1)
  24++C977 2A 87 C0                             ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)          ; hl - XX15(0,1)
  25++C97A ED 5B 8B C0                          ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)          ; de - XX15(4,5)
  26++C97E AF                                   xor     a
  27++C97F 32 6B C9                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; SWAP = 0
  28++C982 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; A = X2Hi
  29++C983 FD 26 BF     .LL147:                 ld      iyh,$BF                     ; we need to be 191 as its 128 + another bit set from 0 to 6, we are using iyh as regX
  30++C986                                      ;       push    af
  31++C986                                      ;       ld      a,iyh
  32++C986                                      ;       ld      (regX),a
  33++C986                                      ;       pop     af
  34++C986 DD B4                                or      ixh                         ; if (X2Hi L-OR Y2 Hi <> 0) goto LL107             -- X2Y2 off screen
  35++C988 20 0A                                jr      nz, .LL107
  36++C98A DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  37++C98C ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; if screen hight < y2 lo, i.e y2 lo >127 goto LL107,
  38++C98F 20 03                                jr      nz,.LL107
  39++C991 FD 26 00                             ld      iyh, 0                      ; else iyh = regX = 0                                                                        -- X2Y2 on screen
  40++C994                                      ;        push    af
  41++C994                                      ;        ld      a,iyh
  42++C994                                      ;        ld      (regX),a
  43++C994                                      ;        pop     af
  44++C994              ; XX13 = regX (i.e. iyh)      ( if XX13 = XX13 is 191 if (x2, y2) is off-screen else 0) we bin XX13 as not needed
  45++C994              ; so XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen,  XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lo is off the bottom of the screen
  46++C994 FD 7C        .LL107                  ld      a,iyh
  47++C996 32 6E C9                             ld      (clipXX13),a                ; debug copy iyh to xx13
  48++C999 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If (X1 hi L-OR Y1) hi  goto LL83                   -- X1Y1 off screen and maybe X2Y2
  49++C99A B0                                   or      b                           ;
  50++C99B 20 27                                jr      nz,.LL83                    ;
  51++C99D 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; or (y1 lo > bottom of screen)
  52++C99E ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  53++C9A1 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  54++C9A3              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  55++C9A3 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  56++C9A5 FE 00                                cp      0
  57++C9A7 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  58++C9A9              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  59++C9A9 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  60++C9AA 32 88 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  61++C9AD DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  62++C9AF 32 8A C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  63++C9B2 7D                                   ld      a,l
  64++C9B3 32 87 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  65++C9B6 7B                                   ld      a,e
  66++C9B7 32 89 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  67++C9BA                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  67++C9BA B7          >                        or a
  68++C9BB C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  69++C9BC              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  70++C9BC 37           .PointsOutofBounds:     scf                                 ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  71++C9BD C9                                   ret
  72++C9BE FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  73++C9C0 B7                                   or      a
  74++C9C1 1F                                   rra
  75++C9C2 FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  76++C9C4                                      ;        push    af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  77++C9C4                                      ;        ld      a,iyh               ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  78++C9C4                                      ;        ld      (regX),a            ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  79++C9C4                                      ;        pop     af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  80++C9C4 FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  81++C9C6 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  82++C9C9 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  83++C9CB 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  84++C9CC A2                                   and     d
  85++C9CD                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  85++C9CD FA BC C9    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  86++C9D0 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  87++C9D1 DD A4                                and     ixh
  88++C9D3                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  88++C9D3 FA BC C9    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  89++C9D6 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  90++C9D7 3D                                   dec     a
  91++C9D8 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  92++C9DA                                      ;        push    af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  93++C9DA                                      ;        ld      a,iyl              ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  94++C9DA                                      ;        ld      (varXX12p2),a      ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  95++C9DA                                      ;        pop     af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  96++C9DA 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  97++C9DB 3D                                   dec     a
  98++C9DC FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  99++C9DE                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  99++C9DE F2 BC C9    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 100++C9E1              ;by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
 101++C9E1 DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
 102++C9E3 3D                                   dec     a
 103++C9E4 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 104++C9E6 78                                   ld      a,b
 105++C9E7 3D                                   dec     a
 106++C9E8 FD B5                                or      iyl
 107++C9EA                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
 107++C9EA F2 BC C9    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 108++C9ED 79                                   ld      a,c
 109++C9EE DD A5                                and     ixl
 110++C9F0                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
 110++C9F0 FA BC C9    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
 111++C9F3              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 112++C9F3              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 113++C9F3              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 113++C9F3 B7          >                        or a
 114++C9F4 E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 115++C9F6 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 116++C9F7 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 117++C9F9                                     ; pop     de                          ; we need de back
 118++C9F9 22 62 C9                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 119++C9FC 7C                                   ld      a,h
 120++C9FD 32 64 C9                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 121++CA00                                     ; ld      a,e                         ;a = x2 lo
 122++CA00                                     ; sbc     a,l                         ;a= a - x1
 123++CA00                                     ; ld      (clipDx),a
 124++CA00                                     ; ld      a,d
 125++CA00                                     ; sbc     a,h
 126++CA00                                     ; ld      (clipDxHigh),a                ; later we will just move to sub hl,de
 127++CA00                                     ; ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a          ; it looks liek we need this later post scale loop
 128++CA00              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 128++CA00 B7          >                        or a
 129++CA01 DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 130++CA04 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 131++CA06 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 132++CA08 22 65 C9                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 133++CA0B 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 134++CA0C                                     ; ld      a,ixl
 135++CA0C                                     ; sbc     c
 136++CA0C                                     ; ld      (clipDy),a
 137++CA0C                                     ; ld      a,ixh
 138++CA0C                                     ; sbc     a,b
 139++CA0C                                     ; ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 140++CA0C                                     ; pop     hl
 141++CA0C
 142++CA0C              ;So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 143++CA0C                                    ;  push    hl                          ; Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs
 144++CA0C 21 63 C9                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 145++CA0F AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 146++CA10 32 DB 9D                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 147++CA13 32 68 C9                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 148++CA16 3A 66 C9     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 149++CA19 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 150++CA1C 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 151++CA1E 2A 65 C9                             ld      hl,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 152++CA21                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 152++CA21 AF          >					xor 	a
 152++CA22 93          >                    sub 	e
 152++CA23 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 152++CA24 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 152++CA25 92          >                    sub 	d
 152++CA26 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 153++CA27 22 65 C9                             ld      (clipDy),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 154++CA2A 2A 62 C9     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 155++CA2D 3A 63 C9                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 156++CA30 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 157++CA33 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 158++CA35                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 159++CA35                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 159++CA35 AF          >					xor 	a
 159++CA36 95          >					sub 	l
 159++CA37 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 159++CA38 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 159++CA39 94          >					sub 	h
 159++CA3A 67          >					ld 		h,a
 160++CA3B                                     ; ld      (clipDx),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out; we still retain the old sign in NonABS version
 161++CA3B              .LL111:               ;  push    de
 162++CA3B                                     ; ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 163++CA3B                                     ; ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 164++CA3B 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 165++CA3C B2                                   or      d
 166++CA3D 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 166++CA3F
 167++CA3F                                      ShiftDERight1
 167++CA3F CB 3A       >			   srl d
 167++CA41 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 168++CA43                                      ShiftHLRight1
 168++CA43 CB 3C       >			   srl h
 168++CA45 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 169++CA47 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 170++CA49              .CalculateDelta:        ;ld      (clipDx),hl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 171++CA49                                      ;ld      (clipDy),de                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 172++CA49              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 173++CA49 AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 174++CA4A 32 F5 9D                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 175++CA4D 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 176++CA4E                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 176++CA4E BB          >                        cp      e
 176++CA4F DA 5F CA    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 177++CA52              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 178++CA52 32 D9 9D     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 179++CA55 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 180++CA56 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 181++CA57 CD 4C B0                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 182++CA5A 32 DA 9D                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 183++CA5D 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 184++CA5F              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 185++CA5F 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 186++CA60 57                                   ld      d,a
 187++CA61 32 D9 9D                             ld      (varQ),a
 188++CA64 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 189++CA65 CD 4C B0                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 190++CA68 32 DA 9D                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 191++CA6B 21 F5 9D                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 192++CA6E 35                                   dec     (hl)
 193++CA6F D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 194++CA70 E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 195++CA71 3A DA 9D                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 196++CA74 32 67 C9                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 197++CA77 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 198++CA79                                      ;       push    af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 199++CA79                                      ;       ld      a,iyl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 200++CA79                                      ;       ld      (varXX12p2),a        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 201++CA79                                      ;       pop     af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 202++CA79 3A DB 9D                             ld      a,(varS)
 203++CA7C 32 68 C9                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 204++CA7F                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 205++CA7F FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 206++CA81 FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 207++CA83 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 208++CA85 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 209++CA88 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 210++CA8A              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 211++CA8A CD B1 CA     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 212++CA8D FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 213++CA8F ED 27 80                             test    $80
 214++CA92 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 215++CA94              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 216++CA94 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 217++CA95 B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 218++CA96 C2 BC C9                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 219++CA99 B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 220++CA9A FA BC C9                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 221++CA9D              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 222++CA9D              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 223++CA9D EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 224++CA9E DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 225++CAA0 C5                                   push    bc
 226++CAA1 DD E1                                pop     ix
 227++CAA3 C1                                   pop     bc
 228++CAA4 CD B1 CA                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 229++CAA7 3A 6B C9                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 230++CAAA 3D                                   dec     a
 231++CAAB 32 6B C9                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 232++CAAE C3 A9 C9     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 233++CAB1
 234++CAB1              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 235++CAB1              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 236++CAB1 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 237++CAB2 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 238++CAB5 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 239++CAB7 32 DB 9D     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 240++CABA E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 241++CABD CD 33 CB                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 242++CAC0                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 243++CAC0                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 244++CAC0 C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 245++CAC3 2A 6C C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 246++CAC6              ;                        ex      hl,de
 247++CAC6                                  ;    ld      hl,bc
 248++CAC6 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 249++CAC7 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 250++CAC9 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 251++CACC               ;                       pop     de
 252++CACC 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 253++CACE FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 254++CAD0 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 255++CAD2 3D                                   dec     a
 256++CAD3 32 DB 9D                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 257++CAD6 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 258++CAD9 CD 33 CB                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 259++CADC                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 260++CADC                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 261++CADC C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 262++CADF                                    ;  push    de                          ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 263++CADF 2A 6C C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 264++CAE2                                    ; ex      de,hl                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 265++CAE2 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 266++CAE3 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 267++CAE5                                    ; ex      hl,de                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 268++CAE5                                    ; ld      hl,bc                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 269++CAE5                                    ; add     hl,de                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 270++CAE5 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 271++CAE8                                    ;  pop     de
 272++CAE8              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 273++CAE8 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 274++CAE9 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 275++CAEC 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 276++CAEE 32 DB 9D                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 277++CAF1 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 278++CAF2 32 DA 9D                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 279++CAF5 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 280++CAF8 CD 5A CB                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 281++CAFB                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 282++CAFB                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 283++CAFB C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 284++CAFE D5                                   push    de
 285++CAFF EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 286++CB00 2A 6C C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 287++CB03 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 288++CB04 D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 289++CB05 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 290++CB08 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 291++CB09 E6 80                                and     $80
 292++CB0B B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 293++CB0C C8                                   ret     z
 294++CB0D E5                                   push    hl
 295++CB0E 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 296++CB10 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 297++CB13 B7                                   or      a
 298++CB14 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 299++CB16 22 DA 9D                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 300++CB19 7C                                   ld      a,h
 301++CB1A E1                                   pop     hl
 302++CB1B ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 303++CB1E C0                                   ret     nz
 304++CB1F              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 305++CB1F E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 306++CB22 CD 5A CB                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 307++CB25                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 308++CB25                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 309++CB25 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 310++CB28 D5                                   push    de
 311++CB29 EB                                   ex      hl,de
 312++CB2A 2A 6C C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 313++CB2D 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 314++CB2E 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 315++CB31 D1                                   pop     de
 316++CB32 C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 317++CB33
 318++CB33
 319++CB33              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 320++CB33              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 321++CB33              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 322++CB33              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 323++CB33 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 324++CB34 32 DA 9D                             ld      (varR),a
 325++CB37 CD A2 CB                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 326++CB3A F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 327++CB3B C5                                   push    bc
 328++CB3C 47                                   ld      b,a
 329++CB3D 3A F5 9D                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 330++CB40 FE 00                                cp      0
 331++CB42 78                                   ld      a,b
 332++CB43 C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 333++CB44 20 23                                jr      nz, LL121
 334++CB46              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 335++CB46 3A 67 C9     LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 336++CB49 32 D9 9D                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 337++CB4C CD 35 AE                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 338++CB4F 22 6C C9                             ld      (varYX),hl
 339++CB52 F1                                   pop     af
 340++CB53 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 341++CB56 CA 95 CB                             jp      z,LL133
 342++CB59 C9                                   ret
 343++CB5A              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 344++CB5A              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 345++CB5A              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 346++CB5A              ;
 347++CB5A              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 348++CB5A              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 349++CB5A              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 350++CB5A CD A2 CB     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 351++CB5D F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 352++CB5E C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 353++CB5F 47                                   ld      b,a
 354++CB60 3A F5 9D                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 355++CB63 FE 00                                cp      0
 356++CB65 78                                   ld      a,b
 357++CB66 C1                                   pop     bc
 358++CB67 20 DD                                jr      nz, LL122
 359++CB69              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 360++CB69 11 FE FF     LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 361++CB6C 2A DA 9D                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 362++CB6F 3A D9 9D                             ld      a,(varQ)
 363++CB72 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 364++CB73              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 364++CB73 CB 25       >			   sla l
 364++CB75 CB 14       >			   rl  h
 365++CB77 7C                                   ld      a,h
 366++CB78 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 367++CB7A                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 367++CB7A B8          >                        cp      b
 367++CB7B DA 86 CB    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 368++CB7E 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 369++CB7F 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 370++CB80 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 371++CB81 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 372++CB82 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 373++CB84 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 374++CB85 3F                                   ccf
 375++CB86              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 375++CB86 CB 13       >               rl  e
 375++CB88 CB 12       >               rl  d
 376++CB8A 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 377++CB8C ED 53 6C C9                          ld      (varYX),de
 378++CB90 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 379++CB91 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 380++CB94 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 381++CB95 2A 6C C9     LL133:                  ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 382++CB98                                      NegHL
 382++CB98 AF          >                    xor a
 382++CB99 95          >                    sub l
 382++CB9A 6F          >                    ld l,a
 382++CB9B 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 382++CB9C 94          >                    sub h
 382++CB9D 67          >                    ld h,a
 383++CB9E 22 6C C9                             ld      (varYX),hl
 384++CBA1 C9           LL128:                  ret
 385++CBA2              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 386++CBA2              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 387++CBA2              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 388++CBA2              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 389++CBA2 3A 67 C9     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 390++CBA5 32 D9 9D                             ld      (varQ),a                    ;Set Q = XX12+2
 391++CBA8 3A DB 9D                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 392++CBAB E5 F5                                push    hl,,af
 393++CBAD ED 27 80                             test    $80
 394++CBB0 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127
 395++CBB2 2A DA 9D                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; else SR = | SR|
 396++CBB5                                      NegHL
 396++CBB5 AF          >                    xor a
 396++CBB6 95          >                    sub l
 396++CBB7 6F          >                    ld l,a
 396++CBB8 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 396++CBB9 94          >                    sub h
 396++CBBA 67          >                    ld h,a
 397++CBBB 22 DA 9D                             ld      (varRS),hl
 398++CBBE 21 68 C9     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign
 399++CBC1 F1                                   pop     af
 400++CBC2 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 401++CBC3 E1                                   pop     hl
 402++CBC4 C9                                   ret
 403++CBC5
# file closed: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
 743+ CBC5              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 744+ CBC5                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm
   1++CBC5              ; Set TransMatTo
   2++CBC5              ; XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)   = sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z XX16(13,12) (15 14) (17 16)
   3++CBC5              ; XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10) = roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10)
   4++CBC5              ; XX16(13 12) (15 14) (17 16) = nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)
   5++CBC5              ; This moves Side XYZ to position 0, Roof XYZ to position 1 annd nose XYZ to position 2 as a copy of each batch of 6 bytes
   6++CBC5              CopyRotmatToTransMat:                       ; Tested
   7++CBC5 21 15 C0     LL15_CopyRotMat:        ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
   8++CBC8
   9++CBC8 11 42 C0                             ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  10++CBCB                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  10++CBCB ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CBCD ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CBCF ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CBD1 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CBD3 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CBD5 ED A0       >                        ldi
  11++CBD7 21 1B C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatRoofvX
  12++CBDA 11 48 C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatRoofvX
  13++CBDD                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  13++CBDD ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CBDF ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CBE1 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CBE3 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CBE5 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CBE7 ED A0       >                        ldi
  14++CBE9 21 21 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatNosevX
  15++CBEC 11 4E C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatNosevX
  16++CBEF                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  16++CBEF ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CBF1 ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CBF3 ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CBF5 ED A0       >                        ldi

  16++CBF9 ED A0       >                        ldi
  17++CBFB C9                                   ret
  18++CBFC

  20++CBFC ~                                    ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
  21++CBFC ~                                    ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  22++CBFC ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  23++CBFC ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  24++CBFC ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  25++CBFC                                      ENDM

 745+ CBFC                                      include "./Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
   1++CBFC              TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15:
   2++CBFC 2A 8D C0             ld		hl,(UBnkXX12xLo)					; get X into HL
   3++CBFF 7C           		ld		a,h			                        ; get XX12 Sign
   4++CC00 E6 80        		and		$80									; check sign bit on high byte
   5++CC02 47           		ld		b,a									; and put it in of 12xlo in b
   6++CC03                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
   7++CC03 7C                   ld      a,h
   8++CC04 E6 7F                and     $7F
   9++CC06 67                   ld      h,a
  10++CC07                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  11++CC07 ED 5B 0C C0  		ld		de,(UBnKxlo)						;
  12++CC0B 3A 0E C0     		ld		a,(UBnKxsgn)						; get Ship Pos (low,high,sign)
  13++CC0E E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  14++CC10 4F           		ld		c,a									; and put sign of unkxsgn c
  15++CC11 CD 3D B5     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC		; this will result in HL = result and A = sign
  16++CC14 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H to give 15 bit signed (*NOT* 2's c)
  17++CC15 67           		ld		h,a
  18++CC16 22 87 C0     		ld		(UBnkXScaled),hl					; now write it out to XX15 X pos
  19++CC19              ; ..................................
  20++CC19 2A 8F C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12yLo)					; Repeat above for Y coordinate
  21++CC1C 7C           		ld		a,h
  22++CC1D E6 80        		and		$80
  23++CC1F 47           		ld		b,a
  24++CC20                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  25++CC20 7C                   ld      a,h
  26++CC21 E6 7F                and     $7F
  27++CC23 67                   ld      h,a
  28++CC24                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  29++CC24 ED 5B 0F C0  		ld		de,(UBnKylo)
  30++CC28 3A 11 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKysgn)
  31++CC2B E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  32++CC2D 4F           		ld		c,a
  33++CC2E CD 3D B5     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  34++CC31 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  35++CC32 67           		ld		h,a
  36++CC33 22 89 C0     		ld		(UBnkYScaled),hl
  37++CC36              ; ..................................
  38++CC36 2A 91 C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12zLo)					; and now repeat for Z cooord
  39++CC39 7C           		ld		a,h
  40++CC3A E6 80        		and		$80
  41++CC3C 47           		ld		b,a
  42++CC3D                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  43++CC3D 7C                   ld      a,h
  44++CC3E E6 7F                and     $7F
  45++CC40 67                   ld      h,a
  46++CC41                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  47++CC41 ED 5B 12 C0  		ld		de,(UBnKzlo)
  48++CC45 3A 14 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKzsgn)
  49++CC48 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  50++CC4A 4F           		ld		c,a
  51++CC4B CD 3D B5     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  52++CC4E B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  53++CC4F 67           		ld		h,a
  54++CC50 CB 7C        		bit		7,h                                 ; if sign if positive then we don't need to do the clamp so we ony jump
  55++CC52 20 16        		jr		nz,ClampZto4                        ; result was negative so we need to clamp to 4
  56++CC54 E6 7F                and     $7F                                 ; a = value unsigned
  57++CC56 20 06                jr      nz,NoClampZto4                      ; if high byte was 0 then we could need to clamp still by this stage its +v but and will set z flag if high byte is zero
  58++CC58 7D                   ld      a,l                                 ; get low byte now
  59++CC59              		JumpIfALTNusng 4,ClampZto4					; if its < 4 then fix at 4
  59++CC59 FE 04       >                        cp      4
  59++CC5B DA 6A CC    >                        jp		c, ClampZto4
  60++CC5E              NoClampZto4:
  61++CC5E 22 8B C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl					; hl = signed calculation and > 4
  62++CC61 7D           		ld		a,l									; in addition write out the z cooord to UT for now for backwards compat (DEBUG TODO remove later)
  63++CC62 32 F5 9D             ld      (varT),a
  64++CC65 7C           		ld		a,h
  65++CC66 32 D8 9D             ld      (varU),a
  66++CC69 C9           		ret
  67++CC6A              ClampZto4:											; This is where we limit 4 to a minimum of 4
  68++CC6A 21 04 00     		ld		hl,4
  69++CC6D 22 8B C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl; BODGE FOR NOW
  70++CC70 7D           		ld		a,l
  71++CC71 32 F5 9D             ld      (varT),a                            ;                                                                           ;;;
  72++CC74 7C           		ld		a,h
  73++CC75 32 D8 9D             ld      (varU),a 						; compatibility for now
  74++CC78 C9           		ret
  75++CC79
# file closed: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
 746+ CC79                                      include "./Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm"
# file opened: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm
   1++CC79              ScaleNodeTo8Bit:								; TODO make signed
   2++CC79 ED 4B 8B C0  	ld			bc,(UBnkZScaled)
   3++CC7D 2A 87 C0     	ld			hl,(UBnkXScaled)
   4++CC80 ED 5B 89 C0  	ld			de,(UBnkYScaled)
   5++CC84              SetABSbc:
   6++CC84 78           	ld			a,b
   7++CC85 DD 67        	ld			ixh,a
   8++CC87 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
   9++CC89 47           	ld			b,a									; bc = ABS bc
  10++CC8A              SetABShl:
  11++CC8A 7C           	ld			a,h
  12++CC8B DD 6F        	ld			ixl,a
  13++CC8D E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  14++CC8F 67           	ld			h,a									; hl = ABS hl
  15++CC90              SetABSde:
  16++CC90 7A           	ld			a,d
  17++CC91 FD 67        	ld			iyh,a
  18++CC93 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  19++CC95 57           	ld			d,a									; de = ABS de
  20++CC96              ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop:
  21++CC96 78               ld          a,b		                            ; U	\ z hi
  22++CC97 B4           	or			h                                   ; XX15+1	\ x hi
  23++CC98 B2           	or			d                                   ; XX15+4	\ y hi
  24++CC99 28 0F            jr          z,ScaleNodeDone                   ; if X, Y, Z = 0  exit loop down once hi U rolled to 0
  25++CC9B                  ShiftHLRight1
  25++CC9B CB 3C       >			   srl h
  25++CC9D CB 1D       >			   rr  l
  26++CC9F                  ShiftDERight1
  26++CC9F CB 3A       >			   srl d
  26++CCA1 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
  27++CCA3              	ShiftBCRight1
  27++CCA3 CB 38       >			   srl b
  27++CCA5 CB 19       >			   rr  c
  28++CCA7 C3 96 CC         jp          ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop
  29++CCAA              ScaleNodeDone:										; now we have scaled values we have to deal with sign
  30++CCAA DD 7C        	ld			a,ixh								; get sign bit and or with b
  31++CCAC E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  32++CCAE B0           	or			b
  33++CCAF 47           	ld			b,a
  34++CCB0              SignforHL:
  35++CCB0 DD 7D        	ld			a,ixl								; get sign bit and or with b
  36++CCB2 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  37++CCB4 B4           	or			h
  38++CCB5 67           	ld			h,a
  39++CCB6              SignforDE:
  40++CCB6 FD 7C        	ld			a,iyh								; get sign bit and or with b
  41++CCB8 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  42++CCBA B2           	or			d
  43++CCBB 57           	ld			d,a
  44++CCBC              SignsDoneSaveResult:
  45++CCBC ED 43 8B C0  	ld			(UBnkZScaled),bc
  46++CCC0 22 87 C0     	ld			(UBnkXScaled),hl
  47++CCC3 ED 53 89 C0  	ld			(UBnkYScaled),de
  48++CCC7 78           	ld			a,b
  49++CCC8 32 D8 9D     	ld			(varU),a
  50++CCCB 79           	ld			a,c
  51++CCCC 32 F5 9D     	ld			(varT),a
  52++CCCF C9           	ret
  53++CCD0
# file closed: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm

 749+ CCD0 21 B3 C0     SetFaceAVisible:        ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 750+ CCD3 ED 31                                add     hl,a
 751+ CCD5 3E FF                                ld      a,$FF
 752+ CCD7 77                                   ld      (hl),a
 753+ CCD8 C9                                   ret
 754+ CCD9              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 755+ CCD9 21 B3 C0     SetFaceAHidden:         ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 756+ CCDC ED 31                                add     hl,a
 757+ CCDE AF                                   xor     a
 758+ CCDF 77                                   ld      (hl),a
 759+ CCE0 C9                                   ret

 761+ CCE1 3A 1C C3     SetAllFacesVisible:     ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+FaceCtX4Addr                                 ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity
 762+ CCE4 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 763+ CCE6 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4  TODO add this into blueprint data for speed                                                           ;;; For loop = 15 to 0
 764+ CCE8 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = Xreg = number of normals, faces
 765+ CCE9 21 B3 C0                             ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 766+ CCEC 3E FF                                ld      a,$FF
 767+ CCEE              SetAllFacesVisibleLoop:
 768+ CCEE 77           EE30:                   ld      (hl),a
 769+ CCEF 23                                   inc     hl
 770+ CCF0 10 FC                                djnz    SetAllFacesVisibleLoop
 771+ CCF2 C9                                   ret
 772+ CCF3              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 773+ CCF3 3A 1C C3     SetAllFacesHidden:      ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+ShipHullFacesCount                           ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity
 774+ CCF6 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 775+ CCF8 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4                                                                                  ;;; For loop = 15 to 0
 776+ CCFA 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = Xreg = number of normals, faces
 777+ CCFB 06 10                                ld      b,16
 778+ CCFD 21 B3 C0                             ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 779+ CD00 3E 00                                ld      a,$00
 780+ CD02 77           SetAllFacesHiddenLoop:  ld      (hl),a
 781+ CD03 23                                   inc     hl
 782+ CD04 10 FC                                djnz    SetAllFacesHiddenLoop
 783+ CD06 C9                                   ret

 789+ CD07              ;;;;  Loop                                              ::LL90
 790+ CD07              ;;;;     inc X
 791+ CD07              ;;;;     divide X, Y & ZtempHiLo by 2
 792+ CD07              ;;;;  Until ZtempHi = 0
 793+ CD07              ;;;;......................................................
 794+ CD07              ;-LL21---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 795+ CD07                                      include "Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm
   1++CD07              ;divdide by 16 using undocumented instrunctions
   2++CD07              Norm256mulAdivQ:
   3++CD07 47               ld      b,a
   4++CD08 0E 00            ld      c,0
   5++CD0A 16 00            ld      d,0
   6++CD0C 3A D9 9D         ld      a,(varQ)
   7++CD0F 5F               ld      e,a
   8++CD10              ;Input: BC = Dividend, DE = Divisor, HL = 0
   9++CD10              ;Output: BC = Quotient, HL = Remainder
  10++CD10              NormDIV16UNDOC:
  11++CD10 21 00 00         ld      hl,0
  12++CD13 78               ld      a,b
  13++CD14 06 10            ld      b,16
  14++CD16              NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP:
  15++CD16 CB 31        	sll	    c		; unroll 16 times
  16++CD18 17           	rla	    		; ...
  17++CD19 ED 6A        	adc	    hl,hl		; ...
  18++CD1B ED 52        	sbc	    hl,de		; ...
  19++CD1D 30 02        	jr	    nc,NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP		; ...
  20++CD1F 19           	add	    hl,de		; ...
  21++CD20 0D           	dec	    c		; ...
  22++CD21              NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP:
  23++CD21 10 F3            djnz    NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP
  24++CD23 79               ld      a,c
  25++CD24 32 DA 9D         ld      (varR),a
  26++CD27 C9               ret
  27++CD28
  28++CD28              ; Tested OK
  29++CD28              NormaliseTransMat:
  30++CD28              ;LL21
  31++CD28 21 53 C0             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevZ+1         ; initialise loop
  32++CD2B 0E C5                ld      c,ConstNorm                 ; c = Q = norm = 197
  33++CD2D 79                   ld      a,c
  34++CD2E 32 D9 9D             ld      (varQ),a                    ; set up varQ
  35++CD31 06 09                ld      b,9                         ; total of 9 elements to transform
  36++CD33              LL21Loop:
  37++CD33 56                   ld      d,(hl)
  38++CD34 2B                   dec     hl
  39++CD35 5E                   ld      e,(hl)                      ; de = hilo now   hl now = pointer to low byte
  40++CD36                      ShiftDELeft1                        ; De = DE * 2
  40++CD36 CB 23       >			   sla e
  40++CD38 CB 12       >			   rl  d
  41++CD3A 7A                   ld      a,d                         ; a = hi byte after shifting
  42++CD3B E5           		push	hl
  43++CD3C C5           		push	bc
  44++CD3D CD 07 CD             call    Norm256mulAdivQ
  45++CD40              		;===call    RequAmul256divC				; R = (2(hi).0)/ConstNorm - LL28 Optimised BFRDIV R=A*256/Q = delta_y / delta_x Use Y/X grad. as not steep
  46++CD40 79                   ld      a,c                         ; BFRDIV returns R also in l reg
  47++CD41 C1           		pop		bc
  48++CD42 E1           		pop		hl							; bc gets wrecked by BFRDIV
  49++CD43 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; write low result to low byte so zlo = (zhl *2)/197, we keep hi byte in tact as we need the sign bit
  50++CD44 2B                   dec     hl                          ; now hl = hi byte of pre val e.g z->y->x
  51++CD45 10 EC                djnz    LL21Loop                    ; loop from 2zLo through to 0xLo
  52++CD47 C9                   ret
  53++CD48
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm
 796+ CD48              ;-LL91---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 797+ CD48
 798+ CD48              ; Now we have
 799+ CD48              ;   * XX18(2 1 0) = (x_sign x_hi x_lo)
 800+ CD48              ;   * XX18(5 4 3) = (y_sign y_hi y_lo)
 801+ CD48              ;   * XX18(8 7 6) = (z_sign z_hi z_lo)
 802+ CD48              ;
 803+ CD48              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 804+ CD48                                      include "Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
   1++CD48              ; TESTEDOK
   2++CD48
   3++CD48              ;ScaleOrientationXX16:                       ; DEBUG TODO will combine with inverse later
   4++CD48              ;        ld      a,(XX17)
   5++CD48              ;        ld      ixl,a
   6++CD48              ;        ld      ixh,9
   7++CD48              ;        ld      hl,UBnkTransInv0x
   8++CD48              ;        ld      a,(hl)
   9++CD48              ;ScaleNode:
  10++CD48              ;        ld      b,ixl
  11++CD48              ;ScaleNodeLoop:
  12++CD48              ;        sla      a
  13++CD48              ;        djnz    ScaleNodeLoop
  14++CD48              ;        ld      (hl),a
  15++CD48              ;        inc     hl
  16++CD48              ;        inc     hl
  17++CD48              ;        dec     ixh
  18++CD48              ;        jr      nz,ScaleNode
  19++CD48              ;        ret
  20++CD48
  21++CD48
  22++CD48              InverseXX16:								; lead routine into .LL42	\ ->  &4B04 \ DO nodeX-Ycoords their comment  \  TrnspMat
  23++CD48              ; we coudl combine this with move to transmat later as an optimisation
  24++CD48              ; INPUT - All Scaled
  25++CD48              ;  They transmat has already been put into side, roof nose order
  26++CD48              ;  XX16   = |sidev_x| |sidev_y| |sidev_z|  1  0  3  2  5  4 note each bytepair is Scaled value in low and high byte just for sign
  27++CD48              ;  XX16   = |roofv_x| |roofv_y| |roofv_z|  7  6  8  9 11 10
  28++CD48              ;  XX16   = |nosev_x| |nosev_y| |nosev_z| 13 12 15 14 17 16
  29++CD48              ; OUTPUT
  30++CD48              ;  XX16(1 0)   ( 3 2) ( 5 4 ) =  sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x
  31++CD48              ;  XX16(7 6)   ( 8 9) (11 10) =  sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y
  32++CD48              ;  XX16(13 12) (15 14)(17 16) =  sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z
  33++CD48              ; First all side values become compoment 0 of each vector
  34++CD48 2A 42 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevX)     ;
  35++CD4B ED 5B 48 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvX)     ;
  36++CD4F ED 4B 4E C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevX)     ;
  37++CD53 22 5A C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x0),hl     ;
  38++CD56 ED 53 5C C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x1),de     ;
  39++CD5A ED 43 5E C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x2),bc     ;
  40++CD5E 2A 44 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevY)     ;
  41++CD61 ED 5B 4A C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvY)     ;
  42++CD65 ED 4B 50 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevY)     ;
  43++CD69 22 62 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y0),hl     ;
  44++CD6C ED 53 64 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y1),de     ;
  45++CD70 ED 43 66 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y2),bc     ;
  46++CD74 2A 46 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevZ)     ;
  47++CD77 ED 5B 4C C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvZ)     ;
  48++CD7B ED 4B 52 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevZ)     ;
  49++CD7F 22 6A C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z0),hl     ;
  50++CD82 ED 53 6C C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z1),de     ;
  51++CD86 ED 43 6E C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z2),bc     ;
  52++CD8A C9                   ret
  53++CD8B
  54++CD8B
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
 805+ CD8B              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 806+ CD8B              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 807+ CD8B              ;   XX12(1 0) = [x y z] . sidev  = (dot_sidev_sign dot_sidev_lo)  = dot_sidev
 808+ CD8B              ;   XX12(3 2) = [x y z] . roofv  = (dot_roofv_sign dot_roofv_lo)  = dot_roofv
 809+ CD8B              ;   XX12(5 4) = [x y z] . nosev  = (dot_nosev_sign dot_nosev_lo)  = dot_nosev
 810+ CD8B              ; Returns
 811+ CD8B              ;
 812+ CD8B              ;   XX12(1 0)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the sidev (or _x)
 813+ CD8B              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+1 and magnitude in XX12
 814+ CD8B              ;
 815+ CD8B              ;   XX12(3 2)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the roofv (or _y)
 816+ CD8B              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+3 and magnitude in XX12+2
 817+ CD8B              ;
 818+ CD8B              ;   XX12(5 4)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the nosev (or _z)
 819+ CD8B              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+5 and magnitude in XX12+4
 820+ CD8B              XXCURRENTN0equN1byN2div256: MACRO param1, param2, param3
 821+ CD8B ~                                    ld      c,0
 822+ CD8B ~                                    ld      a,param3                      ;
 823+ CD8B ~                                    bit     7,a
 824+ CD8B ~                                    jr      z,.val2Pos
 825+ CD8B ~            ;HandleSignebits
 826+ CD8B ~                                    neg
 827+ CD8B ~                                    ld      c,$80
 828+ CD8B ~            .val2Pos:               ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 829+ CD8B ~                                    ld      a,param2                        ; A = XX16 element
 830+ CD8B ~                                    bit     7,a
 831+ CD8B ~                                    jr      z,.val1Pos
 832+ CD8B ~            ;HandleSignebits
 833+ CD8B ~                                    neg
 834+ CD8B ~                                    ld      b,a
 835+ CD8B ~                                    ld      a,c
 836+ CD8B ~                                    xor     $80
 837+ CD8B ~                                    ld      c,a
 838+ CD8B ~                                    ld      a,b
 839+ CD8B ~            .val1Pos:               ld      d,a
 840+ CD8B ~            ;AequAmulQdiv256:
 841+ CD8B ~                                    mul
 842+ CD8B ~                                    ld      a,c
 843+ CD8B ~                                    bit     7,a
 844+ CD8B ~                                    ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 845+ CD8B ~                                    jr      z,.resultPos
 846+ CD8B ~                                    neg
 847+ CD8B ~            .resultPos:             ld      (param1),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 848+ CD8B                                      ENDM
 849+ CD8B
 850+ CD8B
 851+ CD8B               ; TESTEDOK
 852+ CD8B              XX12DotOneRow:
 853+ CD8B              XX12CalcX:              N0equN1byN2div256 varT, (hl), (UBnkXScaled)       ; T = (hl) * regXX15fx /256
 853+ CD8B 3A 87 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaled)                        ;
 853+ CD8E 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 853+ CD8F 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 853+ CD90 57          >                        ld      d,a
 853+ CD91 ED 30       >                        mul
 853+ CD93 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 853+ CD94 32 F5 9D    >                        ld      (varT),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 854+ CD97 23                                   inc     hl                                  ; move to sign byte
 855+ CD98              XX12CalcXSign:          AequN1xorN2 UBnkXScaledSign,(hl)             ;
 855+ CD98 3A 88 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaledSign)
 855+ CD9B AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 856+ CD9C 32 DB 9D                             ld      (varS),a                            ; Set S to the sign of x_sign * sidev_x
 857+ CD9F 23                                   inc     hl
 858+ CDA0              XX12CalcY:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ, (hl),(UBnkYScaled)       ; Q = XX16 * XX15 /256 using varQ to hold regXX15fx
 858+ CDA0 3A 89 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaled)                        ;
 858+ CDA3 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 858+ CDA4 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 858+ CDA5 57          >                        ld      d,a
 858+ CDA6 ED 30       >                        mul
 858+ CDA8 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 858+ CDA9 32 D9 9D    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 859+ CDAC                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = T =  |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256
 859+ CDAC 3A F5 9D    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 859+ CDAF 32 DA 9D    >                        ld       (varR),a
 860+ CDB2 23                                   inc     hl
 861+ CDB3                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkYScaledSign,(hl)             ; Set A to the sign of y_sign * sidev_y
 861+ CDB3 3A 8A C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaledSign)
 861+ CDB6 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 862+ CDB7              ; (S)A = |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256  = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 863+ CDB7 E5           STequSRplusAQ           push    hl
 864+ CDB8 CD 60 B6                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ 1byte add (subtract)
 865+ CDBB E1                                   pop     hl
 866+ CDBC 32 F5 9D                             ld      (varT),a                            ; T = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 867+ CDBF 23                                   inc     hl
 868+ CDC0              XX12CalcZ:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ,(hl),(UBnkZScaled)       ; Q = |sidev_z| * z_lo / 256
 868+ CDC0 3A 8B C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaled)                        ;
 868+ CDC3 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 868+ CDC4 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 868+ CDC5 57          >                        ld      d,a
 868+ CDC6 ED 30       >                        mul
 868+ CDC8 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 868+ CDC9 32 D9 9D    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 869+ CDCC                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 869+ CDCC 3A F5 9D    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 869+ CDCF 32 DA 9D    >                        ld       (varR),a
 870+ CDD2 23                                   inc     hl
 871+ CDD3                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkZScaledSign,(hl)             ; A = sign of z_sign * sidev_z
 871+ CDD3 3A 8C C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaledSign)
 871+ CDD6 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 872+ CDD7              ; (S)A= |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo + |sidev_z| * z_lo
 873+ CDD7 CD 60 B6                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA)   \ 1byte add (subtract)
 874+ CDDA              ; Now we exit with A = result S = Sign
 875+ CDDA C9                                   ret
 876+ CDDB
 877+ CDDB
 878+ CDDB              ;-- LL51---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 879+ CDDB              ;TESTED OK
 880+ CDDB              XX12EquXX15DotProductXX16:
 881+ CDDB              XX12EquScaleDotOrientation:                         ; .LL51 \ -> &4832 \ XX12=XX15.XX16  each vector is 16-bit x,y,z
 882+ CDDB 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                                ; LDX, LDY 0
 883+ CDDE 21 42 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatSidevX
 884+ CDE1 CD 8B CD                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 885+ CDE4 32 8D C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xLo),a
 886+ CDE7 3A DB 9D                             ld      a,(varS)
 887+ CDEA 32 8E C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xSign),a
 888+ CDED 21 48 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatRoofvX
 889+ CDF0 CD 8B CD                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 890+ CDF3 32 8F C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12yLo),a
 891+ CDF6 3A DB 9D                             ld      a,(varS)
 892+ CDF9 32 90 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12ySign),a
 893+ CDFC 21 4E C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevX
 894+ CDFF CD 8B CD                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 895+ CE02 32 91 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zLo),a
 896+ CE05 3A DB 9D                             ld      a,(varS)
 897+ CE08 32 92 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zSign),a
 898+ CE0B C9                                   ret
 899+ CE0C              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 900+ CE0C                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm
   1++CE0C              CopyXX12ScaledToXX18:
   2++CE0C              CopyResultToDrawCam:
   3++CE0C                      ldCopyByte XX12         ,XX18             ; XX12+0 => XX18+0  Set XX18(2 0) = dot_sidev
   3++CE0C 3A 8D C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12)
   3++CE0F 32 7B C0    >                        ld       (XX18),a
   4++CE12                      ldCopyByte XX12+1       ,XX18+2           ; XX12+1 => XX18+2
   4++CE12 3A 8E C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+1)
   4++CE15 32 7D C0    >                        ld       (XX18+2),a
   5++CE18                      ldCopyByte XX12+2       ,XX18+3           ; XX12+2 => XX18+3  Set XX12+1 => XX18+2
   5++CE18 3A 8F C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+2)
   5++CE1B 32 7E C0    >                        ld       (XX18+3),a
   6++CE1E                      ldCopyByte XX12+3       ,XX18+5           ; XX12+3 => XX18+5
   6++CE1E 3A 90 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+3)
   6++CE21 32 80 C0    >                        ld       (XX18+5),a
   7++CE24                      ldCopyByte XX12+4       ,XX18+6           ; XX12+4 => XX18+6  Set XX18(8 6) = dot_nosev
   7++CE24 3A 91 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+4)

   8++CE2A 3A 92 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+5)

   1++CE7B 21 0C C0     LoadCraftToCamera:      ld      hl,UBnKxlo
   2++CE7E 11 7B C0                             ld      de,UBnkDrawCam0xLo
   3++CE81                                      NineLDIInstrunctions                ; transfer 9 bytes
   3++CE81 ED A0       >		                ldi
   3++CE83 ED A0       >		                ldi
   3++CE85 ED A0       >		                ldi
   3++CE87 ED A0       >		                ldi

   6++CE94              CopyCameraToXX15Signed:

   9++CE9A B4                   or  h
  10++CE9B 67                   ld  h,a
